Posts.Content: www.nice.org.uk/page.aspx?o=cg027niceguideline This link is the NICE guideline for all referrals. Waiting times are on Page 6 and specific breast cancer symptoms on Page 23. It says if it is pain without lump it should be a non-urgent referral and doesn't specify a time limit. For all other symptoms listed it should be the 2 week referral route.Good luck.
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: I was referred on the 2 week fast track even though my GP thought the lump was nothing to worry about. Try going back to your GP and asking about the initiative, as I thought all women with symptoms should be seen within 2 weeks, but perhaps I'm wrong. Have you thought of calling Cancer Backup or Breast Cancer Care and asking their advice?
Posts.Title: long wait - is there anything or any way to speed it up

Posts.Content: Hi Kristalou I'm in the same position as you now. What did you decide on in the end; are you happy with the result? Any information you can give, which will help me in making my decision, I would be pleased to receive. How are things with you now? Are you recovering well? Kind regards billinda
Posts.Title: Help! Can't decide on what reconstruction to have.
